CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
2. PEDOT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
3. PSS (Poly(sulfone-co-sulfonamide))
4. PFDTBT-10Per (Poly(9,9-dioctylfluorene-co-9,9-dioctylfluorene-co-perfluorodecyl-4,8-dioxacyclopentadecane))
5. PC71BM (Poly[71-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester])
6. LiF (Lithium Fluoride)
7. TiOx (Titanium Dioxide)

Note that some of these materials are listed with multiple names, e.g., PEDOT is also referred to as PSS, and PC71BM is also referred to as Poly[71-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester].
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph after removing the irrelevant entities:

1. ITO
2. PEDOT
3. PSS
4. PFDTBT-10Per
5. LiF
6. TiOx

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid material names mentioned in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| LiF |
| TiOx |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. Figure 9: This is the name of the figure being referred to in the paragraph.
2. IPCE: This stands for "incident photon-to-current conversion efficiency" and is a measure of the efficiency of converting incident photons into electrical current in a solar cell.
3. ITO: This stands for "indium tin oxide" and is a type of material used in the solar cells being studied.
4. PEDOT: This stands for "poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene)":polystyrene sulfonate" and is another type of material used in the solar cells.
5. PSS: This stands for "polystyrene sulfonate" and is a component of the PEDOT:PSS material.
6. PFDTBT-10Per: This stands for "poly[N-9'-heptadecafluorodecyl]-4,7-diyl-4,7-diyl-perfluorooctyl sulfonate" and is another component of the PEDOT:PSS material.
7. PC71BM: This stands for "PC71BM" and is a type of organic material used in the solar cells.
8. LiF: This stands for "lithium fluoride" and is a component of the solar cells.
9. TiOx: This stands for "titanium oxide" and is another component of the solar cells.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to Material Properties in the given paragraph:

1. ITO
2. PEDOT
3. PSS
4. PFDTBT-10Per
5. PC71BM

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to Material Properties. The other entities, such as "Figure 9", "incident photon-to-current conversion efficiency", and "solar cells", do not refer directly to Material Properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to Material Properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| ITO |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| PFDTBT-10Per |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. Incident photon-to-current conversion efficiency (IPCE)
2. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide)
3. PEDOT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
4. PSS (Polystyrene sulfonate)
5. PFDTBT-10Per (Poly(9,9-dioctylfluorene-co-9,9-dioctylfluorene-co-perfluorodecyl-4,8-dioxacyclopentadecane))
6. PC71BM (Poly(7,7-dichloro-6,6-dimethyl-4,4-dioxacyclopentadecane))
7. LiF (Lithium fluoride)
8. TiOx (Titanium oxide)

Note that some of these entities are mentioned in the context of their role in the devices (e.g., ITO as the substrate material, PEDOT as the electrode material), while others are mentioned as the actual materials themselves (e.g., LiF and TiOx as separate materials).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. IPCE (Incident Photon-to-Current Conversion Efficiency)
2. PEDOT (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
3. PSS (Polystyrene sulfonate)
4. PC71BM (Poly(7,7-dichloro-6,6-dimethyl-4,4-dioxacyclopentadecane))

These are the entities that have a clear relationship to the value of material properties in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Incident Photon-to-Current Conversion Efficiency (IPCE) |
| Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (PEDOT) |
| Polystyrene sulfonate (PSS) |
| Poly(7,7-dichloro-6,6-dimethyl-4,4-dioxacyclopentadecane) (PC71BM) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
